healthEstimate.core.showDescription.name: Show Estimates
healthEstimate.core.showDescription.hint: Show estimates to the selected users.
healthEstimate.core.stateNames.name: Stages
healthEstimate.core.stateNames.hint:
An array of descriptions shown to players, arranged from worst to best possible health.
The amount of possible descriptions is not limited, the module will adjust the health percentage to show them proportionally to the amount.
If there is a need for one description to cover a higher range of health than others simply copy it several times.
healthEstimate.core.deathState.name: Death State on Condition
healthEstimate.core.deathState.hint: Show token as dead when it's been affected by any condition that uses the icon set on the Death Marker setting. Works independently from the macro.
healthEstimate.core.deathStateName.name: Death State Name
healthEstimate.core.deathStateName.hint: The description shown to players when the token is dead. Compendium tab has a macro for marking a token (or several) as dead.
healthEstimate.core.deathMarker.name: Death Marker
healthEstimate.core.deathMarker.hint:
Path to the condition icon that marks the dead tokens.
To get a custom icon's path, select a token marked with it, open the console and enter "canvas.tokens.controlled[0].data.overlayEffect"
healthEstimate.core.NPCsJustDie.name: NPCs die immediately
healthEstimate.core.NPCsJustDie.hint: The last stage of NPCs is replaced by the Death State Name.
healthEstimate.core.perfectionism.name: Perfectionism
healthEstimate.core.perfectionism.hint: Only show the best possible description when the target is in perfect state - not a single damage taken.
healthEstimate.core.outputChat.name: Output Estimate to Chat
healthEstimate.core.outputChat.hint: Output any estimate changes to chat. Characters flagged with the Hide Estimate macro will be shown as "Unknown Entity".
healthEstimate.core.addTemp.name: Add Temporary Health
healthEstimate.core.addTemp.hint:
Include temporary health points in calculating what description to show.
E.g. with the setting turned on the token receiving temp HP will look "healthier" unless it's already at max health.
healthEstimate.core.breakOnZeroMaxHP.nam: Hide on tokens with 0 max HP
healthEstimate.core.menuSettings.fontSiz: Accepts any valid property for CSS font-size
healthEstimate.core.menuSettings.useColo: This won't affect the settings window, but with checkmark off the descriptions will be shown in black and white.
healthEstimate.core.menuSettings.smoothG: With this setting off the color will only change when the next description is reached, with it on it will reflect the health percentage.
healthEstimate.core.menuSettings.positio: Position is set relative to the frame. The number lets you tweak the position relative to its normal place. Positive numbers push it lower, negative â€“ higher. The default value of -1 sets it to "1 line above initial position".
healthEstimate.dnd5e.vehicleNames.hint: Descriptions shown for vehicles if "Use Vehicle Threshold" is off
healthEstimate.PF1.addNonlethal.name: Use Nonlethal Damage
healthEstimate.PF1.addNonlethal.hint: If enabled nonlethal damage will be substracted from current health for estimation.
healthEstimate.PF1.showExtra.name: Disabled & Dying
healthEstimate.PF1.disabledName.name: Disabled
healthEstimate.PF1.disabledName.hint: Description to show when token is precisely at 0 HP or has more nonlethal damage than HP remaining
healthEstimate.PF1.dyingName.name: Dying
healthEstimate.PF1.dyingName.hint: Description to show when token is below 0 HP
healthEstimate.numenera.countPools.name: Count Empty Pools
healthEstimate.numenera.countPools.hint: Count empty pools instead of sum of their values, with the estimation only changing when a pool is depleted/replenished
healthEstimate.starfinder.useThreshold.h: If this setting is on, the "Threshold Stages" descriptions will be used for vehicles above threshold, below it, and at 0 HP respectively.
healthEstimate.starfinder.thresholdNames: The amount of stages is limited to 3, arranged from worst to best condition
healthEstimate.starfinder.vehicleNames.h: Descriptions shown for starships (always), and vehicles (if "Use Vehicle Threshold" is off)
healthEstimate.starfinder.addStamina.hin: With this setting on Stamina will be added to HP for calculations.
The JS formula for calculating the fraction of health token has. Alter with caution. Default assumes simple descending health, e.g. you start with 10/10 in your health field and go down to 0/10 when taking damage.
const hp = token.actor.data.data.health; return hp.value / hp.max
